intro: Sinosenecio qii, commonly known as the Tibetan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and has adapted to cold and dry conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, rough, and hairy, while the flowers are small and yellow. Sinosenecio qii is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
